content.text:
Mr. McCONNELL. Madam President, I move to proceed to executive 
session to consider Calendar No. 254, Steven Bradbury.
content.speaker: Mr. McCONNELL

content.text: The PRESIDING OFFICER. The question is on agreeing to the motion.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER

content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER. The clerk will report the nomination.
  The senior assistant legislative clerk read the nomination of Steven 
Gill Bradbury, of Virginia, to be General Counsel of the Department of 
Transportation.


                             Cloture Motion
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER

content.text: Mr. McCONNELL. Madam President, I send a cloture motion to the desk.
content.speaker: Mr. McCONNELL

content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER. The cloture motion having been presented under 
rule XXII, the Chair directs the clerk to read the motion.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER

content.text:
The senior assistant legislative clerk read as follows:

                             Cloture Motion

       We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the 
     provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, 
     do hereby move to bring to a close debate on the nomination 
     of Steven Gill Bradbury, of Virginia, to be General Counsel 
     of the Department of Transportation.
         Mitch McConnell, John Hoeven, Thom Tillis, Tom Cotton, 
           Cory Gardner, Jerry Moran, John Barrasso, Luther 
           Strange, Mike Crapo, John Cornyn, Richard Burr, Mike 
           Rounds, Orrin G. Hatch, David Perdue, Marco Rubio, John 
           Thune, John Boozman.
content.speaker: The RECORDER
